info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 25 at 11:36AM MDT until June 25 at 1:30PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The McBride burn scar in... South Central Lincoln County in central New Mexico... * Until 130 PM MDT. * At 1136 AM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the McBride Burn Scar. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will impact Gavilan Canyon Road, Blue Lake Drive, Eagle Creek Canyon Road and areas downstream to the Rio Ruidoso. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the McBride Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the McBride Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Ruidoso, Ruidoso Downs and Hollywood. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Runoff from rainfall will cause elevated water levels within vulnerable drainages in and downstream of the McBride fire burn area. Do not camp along streams and rivers. Remain alert when hiking in steep, narrow canyons. Know where you are relative to low spots and drainages.
